geometry.planar

Class Vector

  • java.lang.Object
    • geometry.planar.Vector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IntVector, RationalVector

    public abstract class Vector
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Abstract class describing functionality of Vectors. Vectors are used for translating Points in the plane.
    Version:
    $Id: $Id
    Author:
    Alfons Wirtz
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      abstract Vector add(Vector p_other)
      adds p_other to this vector
      double angle_approx()
      Returns an approximation of the signed angle between this vector and the x axis.
      double angle_approx(Vector p_other)
      Returns an approximation of the signed angle between this vector and p_other.
      abstract Vector change_length_approx(double p_lenght)
      Returns an approximation vector of this vector with the same direction and length p_length.

      Returns an approximation of the cosinus of the angle between this vector and p_other by a double.

      Creates a 2-dimensinal Vector from the 3 input values.

      Creates a Vector (p_x, p_y) in the plane.
      abstract boolean is_diagonal()
      returns true, if the vector is diagonal
      boolean is_multiple_of_45_degree()
      Returns true, if the vector is orthogonal or diagonal
      abstract boolean is_orthogonal()
      returns true, if the vector is horizontal or vertical
      abstract boolean is_zero()
      returns true, if this vector is equal to the zero vector.
      double length_approx()
      returns an approximation of the euclidian length of this vector
      abstract Vector mirror_at_x_axis()
      Mirrors this vector at the x axis.
      abstract Vector mirror_at_y_axis()
      Mirrors this vector at the y axis.
      abstract Vector negate()
      returns the Vector such that this plus this.negate() is zero
      abstract Signum projection(Vector p_other)
      The function returns Signum.POSITIVE, if the scalar product of this vector and p_other > 0, Signum.NEGATIVE, if the scalar product Vector is < 0, and Signum.ZERO, if the scalar product is equal 0.
      abstract double scalar_product(Vector p_other)
      Returns an approximation of the scalar product of this vector with p_other by a double.
      abstract Side side_of(Vector p_other)
      Let L be the line from the Zero Vector to p_other.
      abstract FloatPoint to_float()
      approximates the coordinates of this vector by float coordinates
      abstract Vector turn_90_degree(int p_factor)
      Turns this vector by p_factor times 90 degree.

      • is_zero

        public abstract boolean is_zero()
        returns true, if this vector is equal to the zero vector.
        Returns:
        a boolean.

      • negate

        public abstract Vector negate()
        returns the Vector such that this plus this.negate() is zero
        Returns:
        a Vector object.

      • add

        public abstract Vector add(Vector p_other)
        adds p_other to this vector
        Parameters:
        p_other - a Vector object.
        Returns:
        a Vector object.

      • side_of

        public abstract Side side_of(Vector p_other)
        Let L be the line from the Zero Vector to p_other. The function returns Side.ON_THE_LEFT, if this Vector is on the left of L Side.ON_THE_RIGHT, if this Vector is on the right of L and Side.COLLINEAR, if this Vector is collinear with L.
        Parameters:
        p_other - a Vector object.
        Returns:
        a Side object.

      • is_orthogonal

        public abstract boolean is_orthogonal()
        returns true, if the vector is horizontal or vertical
        Returns:
        a boolean.

      • is_diagonal

        public abstract boolean is_diagonal()
        returns true, if the vector is diagonal
        Returns:
        a boolean.

      • is_multiple_of_45_degree

        public boolean is_multiple_of_45_degree()
        Returns true, if the vector is orthogonal or diagonal
        Returns:
        a boolean.

      • projection

        public abstract Signum projection(Vector p_other)
        The function returns Signum.POSITIVE, if the scalar product of this vector and p_other > 0, Signum.NEGATIVE, if the scalar product Vector is < 0, and Signum.ZERO, if the scalar product is equal 0.
        Parameters:
        p_other - a Vector object.
        Returns:
        a Signum object.

      • scalar_product

        public abstract double scalar_product(Vector p_other)
        Returns an approximation of the scalar product of this vector with p_other by a double.
        Parameters:
        p_other - a Vector object.
        Returns:
        a double.

      • to_float

        public abstract FloatPoint to_float()
        approximates the coordinates of this vector by float coordinates
        Returns:
        a FloatPoint object.

        public abstract Vector turn_90_degree(int p_factor)
        Turns this vector by p_factor times 90 degree.
        Parameters:
        p_factor - a int.
        Returns:
        a Vector object.

        public static Vector get_instance(int p_x,
                                  int p_y)

      • get_instance

        public static Vector get_instance(java.math.BigInteger p_x,
                                  java.math.BigInteger p_y,
                                  java.math.BigInteger p_z)
        Creates a 2-dimensinal Vector from the 3 input values. If p_z != 0 it correspondents to the Vector in the plane with rational number coordinates (p_x / p_z, p_y / p_z).
        Parameters:
        p_x - a BigInteger object.
        p_y - a BigInteger object.
        p_z - a BigInteger object.
        Returns:
        a Vector object.

        a double.
